FuncDef:
The min-rx-interval command sets the interval between receiving BFD packets.
The undo min-rx-interval command restores the default value. The min-rx-interval command sets the interval between receiving BFD packets. The undo min-rx-interval command restores the default value. By default, the interval is 1000 milliseconds.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the interval between receiving BFD packets.
The value is an integer ranging from 3 to 1000, in milliseconds.

ExtraInfo:
You can increase or decrease the interval between receiving BFD packets according to the actual network environment.
If no BFD packet is received within a configured detection period, the link that the BFD session detects is regarded as failed, and the BFD session status is set to Down. To reduce the usage of system resources, when detecting that the BFD session is Down, the system adjusts the interval between receiving BFD packets to a random value greater than 1000 ms. After the BFD session becomes Up, the configured interval is restored.
Asynchronous mode: Detection period = Received Detect Mult of the remote system x Max (Local RMRI, Received DMTI)
